intro: Thesium billardierei, commonly known as the narrow-leaf thesium, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as heathlands and woodlands. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits. Thesium billardierei is a perennial herb that is well adapted to the arid and semi-arid climates of its native range.
